title: The Joy Of The Cross
author: Madame Jeanne-Marie Bouvier de la Motte-Guyon (1648-1717) bio

v1: Long plunged in sorrow, I resign
My soul to that dear hand of Thine,
That hand shall wipe my streaming eyes,
Or into smiles of glad surprise
v2: Adieu! ye vain delights of earth;
I taste no sweets in you;
Unknown delights are in the cross,
All joy beside to me is dross;
v3: The Cross! O ravishment and bliss—
How grateful e'en its anguish is;
There every sense, and all the mind,
v4: Self-love no grace in sorrow sees,
But nobler aims true love employ.
v5: Thy choice and mine shall be the same,
To take the cross and follow Thee,
Where love and duty lead, shall be
